instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 no trackpad
threads.message:
Got a Mac air of which the trackpad is frozen. Keyboard works. I changed the trackpad, same result. Measuring pin 10 of the trackpad connector it showed 0.5-1V not 3.3. After removing the board and no trackpad connected, its 3.3v. R4830 os 0 ohms as it should be. Any ideas?

On a sidenote, there was a tiny liquid spil on C7555 near U7201 which after i replaced the IC and made a wire the mac worked again. Customer had issues with trackpad before the mac died. No liquid on cable.trackpad looks very clean.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 no trackpad
threads.message: Did you try another cable just in case?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 no trackpad
threads.message: Change R4830, can be cracked and fails under load only...

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 no trackpad
threads.message: Yes I tried that, another cable. As for R4830, can we also make a jumper wire cause its 0 ohm?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 no trackpad
threads.message: Found out the 5V was also missing, related to the C7555, the line to L4820 was broken, so I pulled a wire from L4820 to C7555 and working again, thanks for the help guys.
